author: shuwaku
title: Exhibit Largest BlockChainEXPO(JP)
description: Only few JP and East Asia companies recognize Cardano as main BLOCKCHAIN! so, it is difficult to adopt CARDANO into the real business world.

f6_assessments.q0:
According to the author, currently only a few JP and East Asian companies recognize Cardano as the main blockchain, so it is very difficult to apply Cardano to business. So the solution was to exhibit at BC EXPO, the largest business event in JP, and introduce Cardano to Japan's Fortune 500 and public institutions. The idea of ​​the proposal is great, displaying a Cardano booth at the EXPO will help raise awareness about Cardano, the main audience being entrepreneurs who have registered their company and personal names. I totally agree with the solution given, creating a knowledge booth about Cardano will encourage public companies to consider adopting blockchain and other blockchain company will consider switching to Cardano from other chains like Ethereum. This proposal shows a legitimate problem and then provides an idea of ​​a valid solution.
This proposal, instead of stating challenges and risks, provides very clear KPIs. And I think the main challenges in this proposal are how to achieve the target set by the KPI, how to attract interested visitors to this exhibition booth.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is a Process that lays out the details of the actions to be taken, which I find reasonable. The proposal provided a 3-month roadmap with a detailed plan and very specific timelines that made it easy for the community to track the progress of the project.
The $80,000 required budget is also detailed. As a large portion of the budget is allocated for the construction of the pavilion, it is difficult to determine if the values ​​are reasonable since they are highly dependent on the local context. The project team are members of EXPO, the team has prepared a good description of the skills and experience of the members. This can be verified in the website https://expo-dow.com/1279/ which the proposal provides. In my opinion the proponents have expertise and experience in handling large projects and should be able to successfully handle this project. Given the experience of the team and the plan presented, I believe it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: As far as testability goes, the team has achieved excellent results. There is a clear explanation of the milestones, showing 5 milestones with brief descriptions, so that the community is aware of both what will happen and when. In addition, the reference to a website maintained by the Expo stake team enhances the testability of the proposal. The success metrics are well defined, which shows the level of motivation and confidence the team has. In addition, the proposed team has experience in organizing exhibitions through two previous grants from fund 6 (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/367080 ) and fund 7 (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/367080 ) http://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/381820 ). Therefore, I strongly believe that the community will have the essentials for an audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The team argues that Cardano is not yet known in Japan as one of the main competitors in the blockchain industry. Because it prevents it from generating successful use cases in "the real world" of business, it intends to address this situation by participating in a BlockChain Expo where large companies from different sectors participate. While there is a clear alignment with Cardano I do not find a direct relationship with the challenge setting, the concept of minimal-viable hub was not addressed, there is no indication of the intention to form a hub, however, I can agree that there is an indirect alignment since there is a possibility that the contacts that are generated to follow up end up being ADA holders and having an active participation in the ecosystem. So I have decided to assign a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The team submitted the necessary references describing the skills and experience needed to execute this proposal, many of the members are stake pool operators which increases my confidence in the competencies of the team. Additionally this proposal has already been approved and funds have been allocated to them in past challenges and they have successfully executed in previous Expo. Regarding the budget 40% is allocated to structure and decoration issues which is difficult to evaluate if it is appropriate or not as it depends largely on the context, however, all the items included are reasonable to me and allow to know the reasoning of the team behind the requested amount. The implementation plan is simple and well explained, at the time of implementation of this proposal it would already be the third time so I would understand that the difficulties encountered in the first two will be taken into account. I have a couple of concerns regarding this proposal, the first concern is that the amount requested by the team is well above the challenge setting which places a cap of 5% which is around $25,000. The second is that after reviewing the Dashboard for tracking the funded proposals there is no progress in the proposal funded in fund 6, the last update was in December since in January the KPI requirement was not submitted, from this I have one more doubt, it is assumed that the event for which the proposal in fund 6 was funded occurred in October 2021, then it would not be clear to me why it has not yet been reported as completed. Surely there is an explanation for this that I am not seeing but ultimately I think the team should have addressed these issues within the proposal description. So based on my previous analysis I cannot agree or disagree from a feasibility standpoint.
f6_assessments.q2: The explanation of the key milestones is clear, with clearly defined dates. All milestones have a short and concise description that allows me to understand what the steps would be in broad strokes. The KPIs presented are quite concrete and appropriate, but I have not been able to find an update on them and considering that the first Catalyst funded event ends in October 2021 (as explained in your proposal) it would have been great to see the impact and lessons learned. I recommend the team to update the community with this information as it is possible that events like this will happen in other parts of the world and what better way to approach it than with the experiences you have.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is for the presentation of the Cardano blockchain on the Blockchain Expo Tokyo autumn. This according to the proposer is the largest business event in Japan. The proposer wants to secure a booth 6x6m in size and attract visitors with a large sign expressing Cardano logo and a gift. About 10 explainers will meet the visitors and explain the Cardano blockchain in order for the visitors to understand Cardano on the spot.
The goal is rising awareness for the Cardano blockchain and drive adoption. 
This challenge is hardly the place for such proposal in my opinion. First of all the budget far exceeds the 25K that the challenge team asked from the proposers to limit themselves in. Secondly the challenge is oriented to the people that don’t have access to such information. “Delivering information to people who would not otherwise have the access.” The public in the largest business expo in Japan are hardly target group for this challenge. Thirdly this challenge clearly states that “This round will focus much more on 'minimum-viable hubs'” this proposal is hardly any of these things.
Therefore I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal presents a roadmap with minimum detail with monthly objectives.
The proposal presents a budget by sectors for spending, but there is no detail.
The proposer presents the team by name or nickname and a very short experience description. Unfortunately there are no CVs and/or links to linkedin or a similar platform or projects that the team members are associated with. 
History check on the team will take a great deal of time in this way and will be very difficult.
I disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal does not present valid milestones and KPIs that could be followed. Although the proposer states that the auditability could be done trough measurements of the KPIs shown in the proposal, there are only few things that resemble a KPI in this proposal and none of them could be audited in a meaningful way. 
I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: The objective of this proposal is to exhibit at the B.C. EXPO, a large business event in Japan, and introduce Cardano to Japanese Fortune 500 and public organizations with a view to promoting the adoption of Cardano in the real business world. The exhibition is being used as a one off information-delivery event which is a brilliant idea but does not fully address the challenge. Building a community around a hub with a focus on the MVH principle, ensuring that the community is self sustainable and scalable such that it adds value to the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem are the key elements of this challenge. These elements are not fully addressed by the proposal. Proposers also need to provide adequate information on the KPIs to enable us properly assess the impact of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: To execute the proposal, it is anticipated that presentations will be done, pamphlets introducing Cardano, and a comic magazine for beginners will be prepared to help visitors understand Cardano. These activities have been broken down into a timebound plan for the funding period. It would however, be good for proposers to provide more information on the tasks to be undertaken because a task such as "Selection of projects and companies to exhibit and establishment of collaboration" needs to be clarified because it has not been explained in the earlier sections of the proposal. The budget also provides lump sum figures for the budgeted items and would require further breakdown to fully understand it. A 16 member team is mentioned with very little detail on the background and experience of the team. A link has been provided for further information on the team however it takes you to a site which is in Chinese and therefore impossible to understand. Identification of potential risks and challenges to the proposal and explanation of how to manage these risks will demonstrate that the proposal has been well thought through and enhance its feasibility as well.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal indicates that progress will be measured by tracking the numbers listed in the KPIs however, no information has been provided on KPIs. The proposal however makes mention of a dedicated open line open chat where metrics will be reported on. Proposers will do well to connect the KPIs of the project with those of the challenge for a better assessment to be done.

f6_assessments.q0: It's exciting to have a project to bring Cardano's image to the BC.EXPO exhibition at JP. If you want the Japanese to read this proposal easily, please put the Japanese part of the project in a file and post the link here, this will make the proposal leaner. This is an exhibition with a large area, most attendees will rarely go to all the booths, so choosing a good location is very important, to increase interaction with attendees, let's discuss this problem
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap has a suitable deployment time, the team information is provided professionally, there is a separate website for presentation, the capacity of the members is diverse, this is a big plus. As for the $80,000 budget, which is close to 20% of the F8 fund, we need a more detailed list to evaluate.
f6_assessments.q2: The project should provide quantitative indicators during the project implementation, so that the community can follow the project development, I have a few suggestions such as: invitation letter, confirmation email from the exhibition, content presentation of Cardano, picture of cardvisit… As for Fund 7, the project has been funded with 16,000 but no progress update, please send the link so we can review

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to bring Cardano Ecosystems to the market of Japanese Fortune 500. The team intends to attend the Blockchain Expo, the event will attract businesspersons from a variety of industries, to spread awareness of Cardano. The objective is clearly in the scope of the Challenge and would have a good impact across the Japanese business world. It could be a small but powerful group. They could make favorable decisions for the Cardano ecosystem such as adopting Cardano to their business. This will surely add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on the well-written summary skills and experience of the team, I believe that the project is likely to be implemented successfully. But due to the lack of necessary information for the budget break down and risk assessment, I am unable to give the score higher than 3. Although the idea has been funded in the Fund 6 & Fund 7, it is better if the proposer could indicate the additional links to the relevant Youtube channels, Twitter, Linkedin. It would be much easier for the new voters to verify the experience of the team members. As experienced with 2 EXPOs, the detailed timeline and goals are presented very nicely. For the budget of this proposal, the team applied nearly the exact amount of money as well as items break down in the Fund 7. With the team of Japanese people, the community will expect much more details than that. The proposal also don’t have a risk assessment and plans for reducing them, such as the pandemic.
f6_assessments.q2: As far as verifiability is concerned, this proposal provided insufficient information to audit the progress and success. The proposal has defined very clearly what are the success metrics. The key metrics like: distributed Cardano brochures, acquired contacts, and implementation rates are quite hard for the community to audit. Moreover, it is also difficult for curious community members to check the results of the previous funded proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: I will start by reminding that one of the metrics of this challenge is to favor challenges that don’t exceed 5% of the total budget of the challenge, which is 25000 usd. This proposal has a budget of 80000 usd. Other than that, this can be a good idea as it can attract business people to join the cardano community. Since the proposal targets business owners in Japan that would not get to know Cardano otherwise, I think that it will add value to the cardano ecosystem. However I don’t see how this proposal will scale in future challenges, and I suggest to the proposer to add a scaling strategy.
f6_assessments.q1: I don’t have much confidence in the feasibility of this project because there is not enough information. I have counted 17 team members, but the proposer didn’t mention their roles in the proposal. The proposers would also benefit by adding links and resources backing up the skills and experience of the team  members. However, the budget has been broken down into identifiable items. Since I don’t know the cost of running a booth in Japan, I won’t judge its accuracy. Furthermore, the proposer has included a roadmap and a timetable to complete the work. Altogether, the proposer can be improved in the areas that I have outlined in order to increase its chance of being funded.
f6_assessments.q2: This project can be audited because the proposers have provided a roadmap and a time horizon for achievement. Moreover they have added Metrics and KPIs that define the success of the proposal. However I would suggest to the proposer to improve the KPIs by being more specific on the expectations. Other than that, the progress of this proposal should be easy to track.

solution: We will exhibit at the B.C. EXPO, largest business events in JP, and introduce Cardano to Japanese Fortune 500 and public organizations.
experience: Cardano Youtuber / SPO / DC Spark member / Official Ambassador / Lawyer / Certified Accountant / Atara Prism Pioneers Program member
